verses.verse: At this<WH2063> also my heart<WH3820> trembleth<WH2729>, and is moved out<WH5425> of his place<WH4725>.
Hear<WH8085> attentively<WH8085> the noise<WH7267> of his voice<WH6963>, and the sound<WH1899> that goeth out<WH3318> of his mouth<WH6310>. Hear: Heb. Hear in hearing
He directeth<WH3474> it<WH8281> under the whole heaven<WH8064>, and his lightning<WH216> unto the ends<WH3671> of the earth<WH776>. lightning: Heb. light ends: Heb. wings
After<WH310> it a voice<WH6963> roareth<WH7580>: he thundereth<WH7481> with the voice<WH6963> of his excellency<WH1347>; and he will not stay<WH6117> them when his voice<WH6963> is heard<WH8085>.
God<WH410> thundereth<WH7481> marvellously<WH6381> with his voice<WH6963>; great things<WH1419> doeth<WH6213> he, which we cannot comprehend<WH3045>.

For he saith<WH559> to the snow<WH7950>, Be thou<WH1933> on the earth<WH776>; likewise to the small<WH4306> rain<WH1653>, and to the great<WH4306> rain<WH1653> of his strength<WH5797>. likewise: Heb. and to the shower of rain, and to the showers of rain of his strength
He sealeth up<WH2856> the hand<WH3027> of every man<WH120>; that all men<WH582> may know<WH3045> his work<WH4639>.
Then the beasts<WH2416> go<WH935> into<WH1119> dens<WH695>, and remain<WH7931> in their places<WH4585>.
Out of the south<WH2315> cometh<WH935> the whirlwind<WH5492>: and cold<WH7135> out of the north<WH4215>. south: Heb. chamber north: Heb. scattering winds
By the breath<WH5397> of God<WH410> frost<WH7140> is given<WH5414>: and the breadth<WH7341> of the waters<WH4325> is straitened<WH4164>.
Also by watering<WH7377> he wearieth<WH2959> the thick cloud<WH5645>: he scattereth<WH6327> his bright<WH216> cloud<WH6051>: his: Heb. the cloud of his light
And it is turned<WH2015> round about<WH4524> by his counsels<WH8458>: that they may do<WH6467> whatsoever he commandeth<WH6680> them upon the face<WH6440> of the world<WH8398> in the earth<WH776>.
He causeth it to come<WH4672>, whether for correction<WH7626>, or for his land<WH776>, or for mercy<WH2617>. correction: Heb. a rod
Hearken<WH238> unto this, O Job<WH347>: stand still<WH5975>, and consider<WH995> the wondrous<WH6381> works of God<WH410>.
Dost thou know<WH3045> when God<WH433> disposed<WH7760> them, and caused the light<WH216> of his cloud<WH6051> to shine<WH3313>?
Dost thou know<WH3045> the balancings<WH4657> of the clouds<WH5645>, the wondrous works<WH4652> of him which is perfect<WH8549> in knowledge<WH1843>?
How thy garments<WH899> are warm<WH2525>, when he quieteth<WH8252> the earth<WH776> by the south<WH1864> wind?
Hast thou with him spread out<WH7554> the sky<WH7834>, which is strong<WH2389>, and as a molten<WH3332> looking glass<WH7209>?
Teach<WH3045> us what we shall say<WH559> unto him; for we cannot order<WH6186> our speech by reason<WH6440> of darkness<WH2822>.
Shall it be told<WH5608> him that I speak<WH1696>? if a man<WH376> speak<WH559>, surely he shall be swallowed up<WH1104>.
And now men see<WH7200> not the bright<WH925> light<WH216> which is in the clouds<WH7834>: but the wind<WH7307> passeth<WH5674>, and cleanseth<WH2891> them.
Fair weather<WH2091> cometh<WH857> out of the north<WH6828>: with God<WH433> is terrible<WH3372> majesty<WH1935>. Fair: Heb. Gold

Touching the Almighty<WH7706>, we cannot find him out<WH4672>: he is excellent<WH7689> in power<WH3581>, and in judgment<WH4941>, and in plenty<WH7230> of justice<WH6666>: he will not afflict<WH6031>.
Men<WH582> do therefore fear<WH3372> him: he respecteth<WH7200> not any that are wise<WH2450> of heart<WH3820>.
